intro: Koelreuteria formosana, commonly known as the Chinese lantern tree, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its showy, lantern-shaped fruits that turn red in the fall. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, yellowish flowers in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental tree. Its botanical features make it both aesthetically pleasing and ecologically valuable in gardens and landscapes.
